headline: Reddit, Alibaba, McDonald's: 3 Stories in Focus
summary: Morning Brief Hosts Seana Smith and Brad Smith dive into the top trending tickers on Yahoo Finance. Reddit's (RDDT) stock is declining after shareholder Advance seeks to borrow against its $1.2 billion stake as it plans to establish a credit facility according to Bloomberg. Alibaba (BABA) is consolidating its international and domestic e-commerce businesses under the Alibaba E-commerce Business Group. This is a new restructuring effort aimed at addressing intensifying market competition. Meanwhile, McDonald's (MCD) is preparing to refresh its value menu, introducing new McValue deals launching on January 7th. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: McDonald's to expand US value menu as fast food chains battle for bargain seekers
summary: McDonald's will expand its U.S. value menu early next year as it continues to try to win back inflation-weary customers.  Starting Jan. 7, the burger chain will let customers buy one full-priced item from a limited value menu and get another item on that menu for $1.  Items on the menu include a Sausage McMuffin, hash browns, a McChicken sandwich and small fries.

Items on the menu include a Sausage McMuffin, hash browns, a McChicken sandwich and small fries.

headline: McDonald's Announces 'McValue' Program for 2025 to Boost Declining Sales
summary: McDonald's announced its newest value offerings for 2025 Friday morning, as the fast food giant has seen customers tired of high prices turn away from spending on fast food in recent quarters.

headline: Portillo's: Units Of The Future Are Coming Out Of The Oven, But I'm Hoping For A Greater Margin Of Safety
summary: Portillo's lacks a loyalty program and value platform, leading to a -0.9% decline in comparable sales and a 3.5% drop in traffic in Q3 FY 2024. Learn more on PTLO stock here.
